intro: Rubus cicur, commonly known as the common blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring thorny stems and broad, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that develop into aggregate fruits, commonly referred to as blackberries, which are rich in antioxidants. Rubus cicur is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in temperate climates. It is often cultivated for its edible fruits and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
